metadata.title: CVE-2018-13093 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in fs/xfs/xfs_icache.c in the Linux kernel through4.17.3. There is a NULL pointer dereference and panic in lookup_slow() on aNULL inode->i_ops pointer when doing pathwalks on a corrupted xfs image.This occurs because of a lack of proper validation that cached inodes arefree during allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13093` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-201-generic - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-lowlatency - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-201-generic - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-201-lowlatency - 4.4.0-201.233
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1145-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1145.155
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1149-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1149.159
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.135
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1055-azure - 4.15.0-1055.60
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1040-gcp - 4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-201.233').
